snippet: Russia’s troop buildup raised alarms about a possible invasion and drew a sharp rebuke from Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, who said Russia faced diplomatic and economic retaliation.
abstract: Russia masses troops and armored vehicles in at least three regions along Ukraine's eastern border; with referendum on secession looming in Crimea, action alarms interim Ukraine government about possible invasion and significantly escalates tensions in crisis between Kremlin and West; troop buildup is met with sharp rebuke from German Chancellor Angela Merkel.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and ALISON SMALE
byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers reported from Moscow, and Alison Smale from Berlin. Reporting was contributed by Steven Erlanger and Andrew E. Kramer from Kiev, Ukraine; Andrew Roth from Donetsk, Ukraine; Michael R. Gordon and Peter Baker from Washington; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Russia’s troop buildup raised alarms about a possible invasion and drew a sharp rebuke from Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, who said Russia faced diplomatic and economic retaliation.

headline.main: Russian Troops Mass at Border With Ukraine
headline.print_headline: Russian Forces Mass at Border in Ukraine Rift
